newsitem.title: USA: Niagara Mohawk shuts 345 KV power line.
newsitem.headline: Niagara Mohawk shuts 345 KV power line.

text.p: Niagara Mohawk Power Corp Monday shut a 345 kilovolt (KV) transmission line for a scheduled five-day maintenance program, the New York Power Pool (NYPP) said.
"It's expected to be back Friday," a spokesman for the group that oversees the transmission reliability of the state's power grid said.

The outage of the high-voltage line, which runs between Utica and Albany, would reduce the power transfer capacity of the so-called Central-East Interface by 1,000 megawatts (MW), the NYPP spokesman said.
The normal limit on the interface is about 2,600-2,700 MW, he said.
The shutdown of the line would likely push up spot electricity prices in the eastern portion of the grid if a cold snap hit the state, market sources said.
